alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 07 at 12:07PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 300 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 PM HST, radar indicated scattered downpours moving across portions of the South Hilo, Puna, and Kau districts on the Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour in the heaviest showers. Movement of the individual showers was toward the west at about 25 miles an hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hawaiian Paradise Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Mountain View, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates, Keaau, Wood Valley, Pahoa, Pahala, Papaikou, Honomu, Hakalau and Ninole. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 300 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
